title: Child shot, father charged
content:
A Meridian man is facing charges in connection to a shooting that took place at Western Gardens apartments Saturday night where a child was injured.
Curtis Gully has been charged as a felon in possession of a firearm in the accidental shooting of his one-month old child, according to Meridian Police Sgt. Dareall Thompson.
Thompson said based on information provided to investigators, Gully had the weapon at the residence. A juvenile picked up the weapon and it accidentally went off, he said.
Thompson said the infant, who is recovering in a Jackson hospital, is improving.
